item.title: Phyllotaxis with R
item.description: According to Wikipedia, phycllotaxis “is the arrangement of leaves on a plant stem” in botany. The following code show how to draw phycllotaxis patterns using ggplot2. The code was modified from a Project called PHYLLOTAXIS: DRAW FLOWERS USING MATHEMATICS on Datacamp. library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) angle <- 31*pi/180 points <- 900 t <- (1:points)*angle x <- sin(t) y <- cos(t) df <- data.frame(t, x, y) options(repr.plot.width = 4, repr.plot.height = 4) p <- ggplot(df, aes(x*t, y*t)) p + geom_point(alpha = 0.

item.title: boringR: drawing with R
item.description: R provides us with a graphical tool that is precise, beautiful and easy to learn. Besides academic publishing, R can also be used to do arts. Inspired by some blogs, I also tried to creat something beautiful and interesting by R. I call this “boringR” and you can find all the code on my Github repo. Here I would to share with you some of my codes and my creations.
